concept.title: A Brief Lesson on Artifical Intelligence and Chatbots

conbody.p: You may be asking: what on earth is a chatbot? What is AI? Can I trust them?
In short: Artificial Intelligence (AI) chatbots (bots) are an interactive, real-time responsive piece of code that allow a consumer (you!) to interact with a database of knowledge and responses.

There are two kinds of chatbots: bots that use a natural language processing system, or chatbots that utilize keywords and databases. Gwen is the latter, as she uses information gathered and stored on a database, and pulls from metadata tags (more on that later). Our tags and answers are monitored daily by trained IT professionals and board-certified nurse practitioners, so you can rest easy knowing the best and brightest have your health and safety in mind.

When Gwen is asked a question, it will go into her database of questions, and tagged with something called metadata. Metadata are like little invisible hashtags that allow Gwen - and her developers - to quickly tag information and drop it into buckets of information; Gwen these retrieves information from those buckets and gives it to you.
So, the more you talk to Gwen, the smarter she gets. The smarter she gets, the faster you get information!

While chatbots have grown up since their first appearance in the 1960s, there's still plenty of work to be done. Bots today strive to pass the Turing test, or a test that measures a machine's ability to exhibit smart behavior. Language, emotion, and reasoning are all future developments for AI bots - and Gwen is no exception. We are working daily to make her smarter, work harder, and be more personable.
